extractor.prompt:
You are a signal extractor. Your job is to identify concrete, verifiable claims from the input.
Do NOT interpret or analyze. Just extract.

INPUTS:
SOURCE: Mozilla Says It’s Finally Done With Two-Faced Onerep
URL: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/mozilla-says-its-finally-done-with-two-faced-onerep/
CONTENT: In March 2024, Mozilla said it was winding down its collaboration with Onerep -- an identity protection service offered with the Firefox web browser that promises to remove users from hun...
extractor.raw_response:
CLAIM: Mozilla is still promoting Onerep despite winding down collaboration | SOURCE: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/mozilla-says-its-finally-done-with-two-faced-onerep/ | CONFIDENCE: high  
CLAIM: Superbox devices require intrusive software to relay network traffic for cybercrime | SOURCE: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/is-your-android-tv-streaming-box-part-of-a-botnet/ | CONFIDENCE: high  
CLAIM: Most parked domains now redirect to scams or malware | SOURCE: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/12/most-parked-domains-now-serving-malicious-content/ | CONFIDENCE: high  
CLAIM: Kimwolf botnet infected over 2 million Android devices via exposed ADB | SOURCE: https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/kimwolf-android-botnet-infects-over-2.html | CONFIDENCE: high  
CLAIM: AdonisJS bodyparser flaw (CVE-2026-21440) allows arbitrary file writes | SOURCE: https://thehackernews.com/2026/01/critical-adonisjs-bodyparser-flaw-cvss.html | CONFIDENCE: high  

SIGNAL: tech | DIRECTION: down | MAGNITUDE: 9  
SIGNAL: tech | DIRECTION: down | MAGNITUDE: 8  
SIGNAL: policy | DIRECTION: down | MAGNITUDE: 6

claims.text: Mozilla is still promoting Onerep despite winding down collaboration

skeptic.prompt:
You are a professional skeptic. Your job is to find what could be wrong.
For EVERY apparent consensus or trend, you MUST provide a counterargument.

SOURCE: Mozilla Says It’s Finally Done With Two-Faced Onerep

You analyze downstream effects. For each development, ask: "If this continues, what breaks?"

forecaster.prompt:
Convert uncertainty into probability. Every forecast must be:
- Binary (yes/no outcome)
- Time-bound (specific resolution date)
- Falsifiable (clear criteria)

INPUTS:
SOURCE: Mozilla Says It’s Finally Done With Two-Faced Onerep
URL: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/11/mozilla-says-its-finally-done-with-two-faced-onerep/
CONTENT: In March 2024, Mozilla said it was winding down its collaboration with Onerep -- an identity protection service offered with the Firefox web browser that promises to r...
forecaster.raw_response:
FORECAST: Will Mozilla officially end its partnership with Onerep by January 15, 2026? | PROB: 0.75 | DATE: 2026-01-15 | CRITERIA: Official announcement or public statement confirming the partnership has been terminated.  
FORECAST: Will the Kimwolf botnet launch a major DDoS attack targeting critical infrastructure by July 1, 2026? | PROB: 0.60 | DATE: 2026-07-01 | CRITERIA: Confirmation of a large-scale DDoS attack (≥10,000 devices) attributed to Kimwolf in public security advisories.  
FORECAST: Will the AdonisJS vulnerability (CVE-2026-21440) be exploited in a high-profile data breach within 12 months? | PROB: 0.85 | DATE: 2027-01-01 | CRITERIA: Public disclosure of a breach linked to arbitrary file write exploits via the AdonisJS bodyparser flaw.  
FORECAST: Will Russia-aligned hackers use Viber for a major cyberattack on Ukrainian institutions by March 31, 2026? | PROB: 0.90 | DATE: 2026-03-31 | CRITERIA: Confirmation of a Viber-based attack (e.g., data exfiltration or ransomware) targeting Ukrainian military/government entities.  
FORECAST: Will over 50% of parked domains redirect to malicious sites by December 31, 2026? | PROB: 0.70 | DATE: 2026-12-31 | CRITERIA: Peer-reviewed study or industry report confirming >50% of parked domains serve phishing/malware content.
